Key Match Events: The Blazers trailed by 14 after the first quarter, 20 at the half, 38 after the third quarter, and 45 when the final buzzer sounded.
Seven Memphis players reached double-figures as they got run-out after run-out.
The Blazers shot 34% from the field and a shocking 9.5% (4-42) on 3s. They turned the ball over 23 times.
Post-Match Reflections: Chauncey Billups called out his players for a lack of effort, saying they were'soft as hell the whole game' and that 'nobody really fought'.
Billups said he's also looking in the mirror and taking accountability, stating that as head coach, he has to have his team more prepared.
Jerami Grant said the players need to hold a meeting to address what's going wrong and 'figure it out'.
Billups didn't mince words when asked if he plans to watch film of the loss, saying 'No, I don’t want to see that s---. No, no, I’ve seen enough already.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blazers are projected to be one of the worst teams in the NBA this season.
The team's 3-8 record is a result of their early season performance.
The Blazers had a 21-61 record last season.
The team sees the title-contending Timberwolves again for a back-to-back on Tuesday and Wednesday.
Others: The game was hardly watchable, as boos broke out at the Moda Center multiple times.
Anfernee Simons said he couldn't explain what went so wrong Sunday, but said everybody needs to be better.
Simons mentioned the team's 127-102 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves on Friday and mounting frustration with the team's losing record.
